Generation I.Red: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
Generation I.Blue: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
Generation I.Yellow: It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.
Generation I.Stadium: The bulb-like pouch on its back grows larger as it ages. The pouch is filled with numerous seeds.

Generation II.Gold: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows.
Generation II.Silver: It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As it grows older, the seed also grows larger.
Generation II.Crystal: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seeds on its back in order to grow.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As it grows older, the seed also grows larger. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

Generation I.Red: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Blue: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Blue (Japan): First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Yellow: Received from a girl in Cerulean City if the partner Pikachu 's friendship is 147 or higher

Generation III.LeafGreen: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town

Generation IV.HeartGold: Received from Professor Oak in Pallet Town after defeating Red
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Received from Professor Oak in Pallet Town after defeating Red

Generation VI.X: Received from Professor Sycamore in Lumiose City after defeating him
Generation VI.Y: Received from Professor Sycamore in Lumiose City after defeating him

Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Viridian Forest Cerulean City ( Only one )

Generation VIII.Shield: Wild Area News , Pokémon HOME Event Trade Version 1.2.0+

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern , Swampy Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Bogsunk Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern , Swampy Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Bogsunk Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
